greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle giving T(n,r) = number of equivalence classes of Boolean functions of n variables and range r=0..2^n under action of symmetric group.
reference: M. A. Harrison, Introduction to Switching and Automata Theory. McGraw Hill, NY, 1965, p. 147.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2057
Index entries for sequences related to Boolean functions
program: permcount(v) = {my(m=1, s=0, k=0, t); for(i=1, #v, t=v[i]; k=if(i>1&&t==v[i-1], k+1, 1); m*=t*k; s+=t); s!/m}
Fix(q,x)={my(v=divisors(lcm(Vec(q))), u=apply(t->2^sum(j=1, #q, gcd(t, q[j])), v)); prod(i=1, #v, my(t=v[i]); (1+x^t)^(sum(j=1, i, my(d=t/v[j]); if(!frac(d), moebius(d)*u[j]))/t))}
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 04 2000
